note.p: Birth: Raysthorpe, near Malton, Yorkshire, England (11 June 1769)
Education: Matriculated from Magdalene College, Cambridge (1786); migrated to Trinity Hall (1787). BA (1790, 3rd Wrangler, 2nd Smith's Prizeman), MA (1793)

Career: Rector of Hunmanby-with-Muston, near Filey, Yorkshire (1795); Archdeacon of Cleveland (1820-1828); Archdeacon of the East Riding (182801841); Vicar of Thorpe Bassett (1820-1827); Prebendary of York (1823); Prebendary of Chester (1827)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1843 No 58 p 489
